page.title: 06Bridgerule Parish Hall
page.content: The Parish Hall was built by local prople and was opended on June 15th 1957. Eleven men helped to build the hall in September 1954 and in the entrance there are some pictures depicting the building and the opening ceremony. There is also a picture showing the carnival tea. The Carnival is the climax of the annual Revel week held in Bridgerule which is the major fund-raising event of the village year. Features of the event include a quiz, skittles tournament, disco and various other games. The Parish Hall is widely used by members of the village including the WI, Badminton Club and Parish Council as well as being used by the Primary School for indoor games and Country Dancing.
